s.text: True, the WP calls it "largely symbolic"--but not until the 10th paragraph, after first calling it "a dramatic upheaval" and "part of a broad make-over."

With the federal government having just given itself pay raises across the board without having produced a budget for the fiscal year that starts tomorrow one looks in vain for the alternative headline "STATES TO TIE POLITICIAN PAY TO RESULTS."

Yesterday, Bill Clinton announced that he would cancel all $5.7 billion of the debt owed to the U.S. by 36 desperately poor countries, provided they channel the money thus saved into the likes of education and health.
Yesterday, Republican presidential candidate Gary Bauer held a press conference to deny rumors (launched by former officials of his campaign) that he's had an adulterous affair with an aide.
Yesterday, Republican presidential candidate Gary Bauer held a press conference to deny rumors (launched by former officials of his campaign) that he's had an adulterous affair with an aide.
